key_title: Key to the species of Caesia

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the genera of Xanthorrhoeaceae

source.author: Conran, J.G.
source.title: Liliaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conran, J.G. (1994). Liliaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Perianth strongly spirally twisted after anthesis; inflorescence more or less erect, usually exceeding leaves
Perianth barely twisting after anthesis; inflorescence decumbent, not exceeding leaves; plant of damp alpine areas
Roots basally fibrous with tuberous swellings distally; upper flowers on inflorescence more or less clustered, perianth segments 6–10 mm long, blue to mauve
Roots fleshy-fibrous to narrowly tuberous; flowers more or less evenly spaced; perianth segments 3–8.5 mm long, white to blue
